intro: Trichlisperma paucifolium, commonly known as the few-leaved trichlisperma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is known for its small, yellowish flowers. It has a creeping growth habit with fibrous roots and is often found in grassland environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
